reviews.text: Stayed here one night to attend a wedding in town. The room was basic but clean. Pool was large. The breakfast that they hype wasn't that great - fatty sausage and frozen French toast, etc.
reviews.title: Okay for one night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd check out other hotels in the area. I thought it was over priced for the ambience.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - Front desk nice

reviews.text: I booked this hotel due to the trip advisor remarks.
reviews.title: very relaxing

reviews.text: It was great for the money, and the front desk night staff was very nice.
reviews.title: Friendly staff

reviews.text: Breakfast was good, and the guy that was constantly refreshing and cleaning it was great.
reviews.title: Best experience ever

reviews.text: Driving late at night with a toddler and the hotel we planned to stay at had no cribs. Called Erin at AmericInn and not only did she have one she had it set up and ready to go in the five muntjac from the time we took to get there after we called. She also unlocked the breakfast juice machine for us so we could get our little one to settle for bed. Everything else was awesome...great beds, clean, friendly. And bak fast had anything you could want in a breakfast buffet! I can't say enough about the end of our trip because the other two hotels on our trip left us feeling pretty upset in general and this hotel gave us faith back. Thank you to Erin and everyone else at AmericInn for making our short stay easy, affordable and the best hotel experience of our trip!!
reviews.title: Fantastic customer service!!!

reviews.text: Beautiful place with great room. Everything wonderful.
reviews.title: Nice welcome at end of day

reviews.text: The service at this hotel was outstanding. The staff was very helpful in whatever I needed whenever I needed it. I stayed at this hotel for two months for work and I would definitely stay here again. I would recommend this hotel to anybody passing through the Detroit Lakes, MN area. The location was great, it's right in the middle of town and anything you would need is five minutes or less away.
reviews.title: Best hotel to stay in at Detroit Lakes, MN for your buck.
Clean, pleasant and affordable
reviews.text: Marking this place as a "stay again". Everything went off without a hitch!
Our family has stayed at the AmericInn in Detroit Lakes many times, usually over Christmas.
reviews.title: Nice, but bring ear plugs

reviews.text: Stayed at AmericInn one night because of a funeral. Room was clean and convenient. Noise level from the train whistle was lower here than other hotels in the area. They need to spend money on new sheets and better beds - both were rough. The staff was friendly, self service breakfast was OK, rates were reasonable.
reviews.title: Clean and Loved the TV

reviews.text: We needed lodging for one night in order to attend a funeral. I called directly and they said they would offer a bereavement discount, which I consider very generous.
reviews.title: Modern, Courteous Staff, and CLEAN
Best Stay Ever!
reviews.text: We arrived from the Twin Cities and found they had our registration form prepared in advance. Nice to have all set when we arrive tired. The room was warm, nicely decorated, modern and CLEAN. (I am an infection control practitioner and appreciate cleanliness.) The breakfast buffet was more than adequate. My family also appreciated that the TV was wall mounted so you have more counter space. We would definitely stay here again and recommend this facility to others.
